results.title: The Pandemic Erased Two Decades of Progress in Math and Reading
results.abstract: The results of a national test showed just how devastating the last two years have been for 9-year-old schoolchildren, especially the most vulnerable.

media.caption: The declines in the national test scores spanned almost all races and income levels and were markedly worse for the lowest-performing students.
media.copyright: Jim Wilson/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Rivers;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Conservation of Resources;Fishing, Sport;Trout;Rafts;Land Use Policies;Water;Colorado;Arkansas River
results.title: Does This Fisherman Have the Right to Be in a Billionaire’s Backyard?
results.abstract: A fight along Colorado’s waterways pits an alliance of white-water rafters and amateur anglers against some of the nation’s wealthiest landowners, bruising the image of a sportsman’s paradise.

media.caption: Roger Hill, a fly fisherman, in the Arkansas River east of Cotopaxi, Colo. He has sued to have the state clarify its laws around one of his favorite fly-fishing grounds.
media.copyright: Benjamin Rasmussen for The New York Times

results.title: Mary Peltola, a Democrat, Defeats Sarah Palin in Alaska’s Special House Election
results.abstract: Ms. Peltola notched a major upset against Ms. Palin and will finish the remaining four months of the term of Representative Don Young, who died in March.

media.caption: Mary Peltola’s victory in Alaska adds to a series of recent wins for Democrats.
media.copyright: Ash Adams for The New York Times

results.title: Ken Burns Explores America’s Inaction During the Holocaust

results.title: Lea Michele Is Well Aware That the Pressure Is On
results.abstract: She’s landed her dream role in “Funny Girl.” Now she’s tasked with rescuing the faltering Broadway show and proving that she is not the person she once was.

media.caption: “I feel more ready than I ever have before, both personally and professionally,” said Lea Michele, who is set to make her first “Funny Girl” appearance on Tuesday.

results.title: He Spent $57,000 in Covid Relief on a Pokémon Card. Now the U.S. Owns It.
results.abstract: The mint Charizard trading card will be auctioned off with other fraudulently obtained luxury items seized by the U.S. Marshals. Its former owner was sentenced to three years in prison.

results.title: 14 Chicken Recipes Our Readers Can’t Get Enough Of

results.title: Moosewood, the Beloved Vegetarian Restaurant, Prepares for Its Second Act
results.abstract: The Ithaca, N.Y., destination was revolutionary because of its menu and its collective ownership model. Recently, the new owners hosted a dinner to celebrate its past and future.

media.caption: The dinner, which featured sweet pea hummus; baby beet salad; Orecchiette with pea shoots, carrots and French radishes; and chickpea stew with panisses, was served family style.
media.copyright: Adrianna Newell
